alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:25PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Clackamas, east central Yamhill, northwestern Marion and southern Washington Counties through 300 PM PDT... At 224 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newberg, or 13 miles east of McMinnville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newberg, Wilsonville, Canby, Dayton, Aurora, Butteville, Woodburn, Sherwood, Mount Angel, Hubbard, Dundee, Donald, St. Paul, Barlow and Monitor. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 271 and 285. State Highway 18 near mile marker 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area
